intro: Valerianella triquetra, commonly known as three-angled valerian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers and fern-like, trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. It produces small, three-angled fruits that contain the seeds. Valerianella triquetra is often used in herbal medicine for its mild sedative properties.
